links.title: Cathie Wood rejects Fed's inflation 'jawboning,' pivots back to deflation narrative
links.description: Wall Street's rate-hike jitters have wreaked havoc on high-growth tech stocks - and Cathie Wood's Ark ETFs were front and center for the damage yet again. Still, Wood dismissed concerns over inflationary pressures, reaffirming an earlier assertion that deflation remains the focus for her firm during a webcast on Tuesday.

body: $AAPL H&S forming on the daily at the top of the linear regression channel where reversals always & imminently occur. It looks to have a date with destiny at the classic 61.8 Fib retracement level around 158. The McClellan is still falling indicating breadth is declining along with a falling RSI & macd & ADX. You want to sell the ADX at the top & buy at the bottom. Plus it is in an Elliott abc corrective wave & the BB's are contracting with the alligator rolling over indicating a fall. Those charts to follow.

links.title: Apple Closes 20 Retail Stores Across U.S. Due to Surge in COVID Cases
links.description: Apple is reportedly closing about 20 of its retail stores across the United States due to the surge of COVID-19 cases throughout the country. On Monday, the company said that retail locations would temporarily shut their doors for several reasons related to the spread of the omicron variant, according to The New York Times .

body: $AAPL https://dfw.cbslocal.com/2021/12/28/apple-closing-stores-shoppers-spike-covid/

links.title: Apple Closing Some Stores To Shoppers After Spike In New COVID Cases
links.description: NORTH TEXAS (CBSDFW.COM) - Apple is temporarily shutting down some stores to in-person shoppers, again. The company is making the move due to rising COVID-19 cases. The tech giant has closed the doors at dozens of stores in Texas, Georgia, New York, Los Angeles, and Washington, D.C. for the foreseeable future.
